Choose a magazine, read a small article and try to understand the way of their writing. Make sure you are able to write something better then that and make a sample article on similar topic. Send it to the editor of the Magazine via email, post, their website contact form. If they like your work, they'll take you, if they don't, choose the other magazine and keep moving on. :)

You do realize that print magazines are dying and are being replaced by digital editions.  Take a few journalism classes to bring you up to speed on ethics, handling sources, editorial interactions, etc.  It sounds like you have the writing skills and area expertise to start submitting freelance articles "on spec" to the magazines you find most interesting. Start building a rapport with their editorial staff. At some point, they might start giving you specific assignments or ideas. And, if you are becoming recognized -- may offer you a job.  Be prepared for rejection -- and you can always re-work or re-shop your rejected piece to another publication. Just remember, exclusivity -- no shotgun submissions to multiple publications simultaneously.  Good luck.
